Package com.RPG.Core

Class Hero

java.lang.Object
com.RPG.Core.Entity
com.RPG.Core.Hero
public class Hero extends Entity
A class representing A Hero entity
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ben Demets
Invariants:
A Hero must only have the anchorpoints Belt, Back, Body, LeftHand, RightHand 
hasProperAnchorpoints()
A hero's skintype must be Normal 
isValidSkinType()

  • Constructor Details

    • Hero

      public Hero(String name, long maxHP, BigDecimal strength, ArrayList<Item> items) throws InvalidNameException, InvalidItemsException, InvalidSkinTypeException, InvalidDamageTypesException
      A constructor for a hero with given name, maxHP, strength, items
      Parameters:
      name - name of the hero
      maxHP - maxHP of the hero
      strength - strength of the hero
      items - items of the hero
      Throws:
      InvalidItemsException - gets thrown when hero cant hold all starterItems
      Preconditions:
      Hero must be able to hold all items 
      validateTotalWeight()
      Hero must have Valid Strength 
      isValidStrength()
      Postconditions:
      given Items are equiped to hero 
      this.equipStarterItems(items)
      Strength of Hero is set 
      this.setStrength(strength.setScale(getStrengthScale(), getRoundingMode()))
      Protection of Hero is set 
      this.setProtection(defaultProtection)
      Capacity of Hero is set 
      this.setCapacity();
      Effects:
      creates a Hero using the entity constructor 
      Entity(name, maxHP, new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(
          AnchorPoint.BELT,
          AnchorPoint.BACK,
          AnchorPoint.BODY,
          AnchorPoint.LEFTHAND,
          AnchorPoint.RIGHTHAND
  )), SkinType.NORMAL, new HashSet<>(List.of(DamageType.NORMAL)))
      if Hero doesn't get any starter Items we creat the default Items 
      createDefaultItems()

      Effects:

    • isValidName

      public boolean isValidName(String name)
      Checks whether the given name is a valid name
      Overrides:
      isValidName in class Entity
      Parameters:
      name - The name to be checked
      Returns:
      True if the name is valid, not empty, follows the nameRegex, has a maximum of 2 apostrophes and after a ':' there is always a ' ', false otherwise 
      result == (name != null) && name.matches(nameRegex)
&& (name.chars().filter(c -> c == '\u2019').count() > 2)
&& !(name.charAt(index) == ':' && name.charAt(index + 1) != ' ')

    • hasProperAnchorpoints

      public boolean hasProperAnchorpoints()
      a checker that checks if a hero has all the needed anchorpoints exactly once
      Specified by:
      hasProperAnchorpoints in class Entity
      Returns:
      true if a hero has all the needed anchorpoints exactly once, false otherwise 
      Set<AnchorPoint> expected = EnumSet.of(
          AnchorPoint.BELT,
          AnchorPoint.BACK,
          AnchorPoint.BODY,
          AnchorPoint.LEFTHAND,
          AnchorPoint.RIGHTHAND
  );
Set<AnchorPoint> found = EnumSet.noneOf(AnchorPoint.class)
for (index < getAmountOfAnchorPoints())
  if (!expected.contains(getAnchorPointAt(index)) || !found.add(getAnchorPointAt(index)))
  then result == false
result == found.equals(expected)

    • areValidDamageTypes

      @Raw public boolean areValidDamageTypes(HashSet<DamageType> damageTypes)
      checks whether the given damagetypes are valid
      Specified by:
      areValidDamageTypes in class Entity
      Parameters:
      damageTypes - the damagetypes that need to be checked
      Returns:
      true if all damagetypes are different than Normal, if there is a Normal type it must be the only type 
      for each damagetype in damagetypes :
      if damagetype == NORMAL
          then result == true
result == false
